author: Lara Martin
title: Fans urge BRIT Awards 2017 to do George Michael proud with tonight's special mystery tribute
text:
Fans urge BRIT Awards 2017 to do George Michael proud with tonight's special mystery tribute Mystery surrounds how the BRIT Awards will pay tribute to George Michael tonight Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Organisers of the BRIT Awards 2017 have confirmed the show will pay tribute to George Michael, calling him a “true British music icon.” 
A rep for the show said no further details about the tribute would be released, with all being revealed during Wednesday night’s live ceremony. 
However, that hasn’t stopped fans taking to social media with theories about how the show will honour the legendary star. 
Broadcaster and producer Ben Jones tweeted: “Coldplay to perform and pay tribute to George Michael tonight at #TheBrits.” 
If true, it wouldn’t be the first time Coldplay honoured George; in December, shortly after the Wham! star’s death, frontman Chris Martin played Last Christmas during a surprise performance at a homeless shelter and dedicated it to George. 
Fans took to the BRIT Awards official Facebook page to urge the show to honour George in an appropriate way. Others thought George should receive a special icon award for his contribution to music. George Michael fans want the BRITS to do him proud (Photo: Facebook) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now How to watch The Brit Awards 2017 Share this video Watch Next 
Michaela Goss wrote: “Please Honour him correctly, George was loved by many not only his Family and Friends, but by every single fan, he was loved by his fellow artists too please remember this when you do a tribute to him tonight, i am really hoping for a life time achievement award its the very least the Brits owe him, please make sure someone collects it that knows him well, Elton John, Paul Young, Martin and Shirlie Kemp spring to mind.” 
Emma Hyde added: “Hope our George is honoured with the respect he deserves. An irreplaceable musical genius.” 
Sarah Thompson said: “I want to watch but then I don’t want to watch. It’s all so wrong, he should b where performing. Just hope they do him proud. They’re massive shoes to fill.” Mystery surrounds the tribute (Photo: Facebook) Fans are happy to see George remembered (Photo: Facebook) George Michael died on Christmas Day (Photo: Getty) Read More 
There are many big name stars confirmed for tonight’s show including Katy Perry, Ed Sheeran. Robbie Williams, The 1975, Skepta and Little Mix, so any one of them could take part in the tribute. 
Or it could be a surprise star not announced beforehand. 
Over at the Grammy Awards in the US, it was Adele who honoured George during that show’s tribute to the global star. 
She performed a version of Fastlove in his memory, but called for the performance to be stopped when she went off-key during the first chorus. She then started again and pulled off a flawless performance. 
"I f**ked up, I can’t do it again like last year,” she said, visibly upset. 
"I'm sorry, I can't mess this up for him." Adele pays tribute to George Michael (Photo: REUTERS) 
George was 53 years old when he died on Christmas Day. 
As ever, fans in the UK can watch all the action on ITV with an exclusive broadcast, while Clara Amfo, Laura Jackson and Alice Levine will host live from the red carpet and backstage either side of the main show on ITV2. 
However, that's not all - the BRITs will also air live on YouTube at 7.30pm, which will be fronted by the platform's presenter-in-chief Casper Lee. 
Geoff Taylor, chief executive of the BPI & BRIT Awards said: "We are always looking for ways for The BRITs to reach as wide an audience as possible given the global interest and huge international artists taking part in the show. 
"It’s really exciting for us that so many people around the world will get the chance to celebrate the UK’s biggest night in music live as it happens.”
